alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 07 at 1:50PM PST until January 08 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST MONDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Large breaking waves with dangerous rip currents. High surf of 10 to 15 feet. Highest surf on west and northwest facing beaches. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Enhanced beach erosion is also possible across the Ventura Coast and around Point Conception with minor beach flooding, especially around the Sunday 6am high tide.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
